metadata.feature_description: Configure granular permissions for each workflow state

steps.expected: Workflows page should display with list of available workflows
steps.actual: Workflows page displayed showing Direct Publish, Save Draft, Content Approval, and Test Workflow

steps.action: Click on Content Approval workflow to expand
steps.expected: Workflow states should be visible with edit options
steps.actual: Content Approval workflow expanded showing Draft, Ready For Review, and Published states with edit icon on Ready For Review

steps.action: Click edit icon on Ready For Review state
steps.expected: Workflow State Edit dialog should appear with permissions configuration
steps.actual: Workflow State Edit dialog opened showing State Name, Reviewers section with roles table, Add User section, and notification options

steps.action: View existing roles in the permissions table
steps.expected: Default roles should be displayed with Review checkboxes
steps.actual: Roles displayed: Administrators (locked), All Users, Content Editors, Registered Users, Content Managers (checked with delete option)

steps.action: Select Community Manager from Select Role dropdown and click ADD
steps.expected: Community Manager role should be added to the reviewers list
steps.actual: Community Manager role was added to the table with Review checkbox checked and Delete action available

steps.action: Click Delete link next to Community Manager role
steps.expected: Community Manager role should be removed from the reviewers list
steps.actual: Community Manager role was removed from the table and became available again in the Select Role dropdown

steps.action: Type 'super' in the Add User search field
steps.expected: User search should display matching users
steps.actual: SuperUser Account appeared in the dropdown search results

steps.action: Select SuperUser Account and click ADD
steps.expected: SuperUser Account should be added to the users permissions table
steps.actual: SuperUser Account was added to a separate Users table with Review checkbox checked and Delete action available

steps.action: View notification checkboxes in the state edit dialog
steps.expected: Notification options should be visible and configurable
steps.actual: Two notification options visible: 'Notify Author and Reviewers of state changes' (checked) and 'Notify Administrators of state changes' (checked)

steps.action: Uncheck 'Notify Administrators of state changes' checkbox
Click Accept button to save changes
steps.expected: Dialog should close and changes should be saved
steps.actual: Dialog closed successfully and returned to the Content Approval workflow view

observations: The Administrators role has a locked permission (always has Review access) and cannot be modified or deleted
The first and last workflow states (Draft and Published) do not have an edit option for permissions - only intermediate states like Ready For Review have configurable permissions
The feature uses a REVIEW permission key that determines who can review/approve content at each workflow state
Both role-based and user-specific permissions can be configured independently for each workflow state
